page.title: 08ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: ALL SAINTS' CHURCH-EAST HANNINGFIELD The original church, the site of which lies about a mile to the south of the village, may have been founded in the reign of King Canute about 1017-35. The church was entirely destroyed by fire on Sunday,31st December 1883. The communion plate and parish records were rescued and are on display in the new church. The new church was built in the village in 1884-85. The foundation stone was laid on the 16th July 1884 and was re-dedicated on the 6th June 1885 - the church therefore being 100 years old this year. It is composed of brick core rendered with lime set plaster, faced with stone and rag stone flints and has a timber steeple.
